text: When I test my web service it is showing Chinese chars as '?????'. When I run the same query using curl, it shows the chars as expected. Stepping through the code, it is writing to the response properly too. From my point of view, it looks like JMeter is not displaying these chars properly. Do I need to do something to the client to make this work or is this a bug?

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Do you have a Chinese version of Java?

Maybe the problem is that Java does not have the required fonts.
Alternatively, perhaps the charset encoding is wrong or not being correctly detected.

creator: dustin.digmann@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 28994
UTF-8 Servlet Test

Attached is a quick servlet to test the UTF-8 issues I was having. It turns out in this test things are working as expected. I am still investigating why chars are not showing up in other cases.
What is the enconding returned by your webservice ?
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com

text: It turns out we just needed to add -Dfile.encoding=UTF-8 to our container. It is odd we needed to do this to have a client return the proper encoding but I honestly think this was an issue on our end. Sorry for the confusion.
